It would be nice to see a control like the ones above from the MS labs show up here at the WPF Toolkit.  Even if it isnt showing huge web datasets, a control that allows the user to move so effortlessly between massive amounts of data visualizations would be a nice thing to have.  Think of it against a cube type database.

That is the kind of visionary controls that would be nice to see in the WPF Toolkit.  What other suggestions do people have?  Maybe we can kickstart some life back into this project instead of the same old boring ( though neccesary ) data grid and Ribbon Control.  We need some WPF love and goodness soon, or I am gonna start doing Silverlight <grin>.  Hey MS,  how about a christmas present or two for us WPF developers?   Even the transitioning layout panel that that link shows would be a neat thing to have. 

Paul

The control made into Windows Phone, can it now make into WPF proper please? It's a fantastic way to display tabs and, in theory, the work is already done. Please, please release a Pivot control for WPF, specifically the Modern/Metro/Win8Store apps to use.

Thanks
